item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 644.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004 - Prohibits the actuarial value of the prescription drug benefits of any Member of Congress enrolled in a Federal health benefits plan from exceeding the actuarial value of basic prescription drug coverage as defined in the Voluntary Prescription Drug Benefit Program of the Social Security Act.

bill.title: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004

item.title: Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004
Taste of Our Own Medicine Act of 2004
A bill to ensure that Members of Congress do not receive better prescription drug benefits than medicare beneficiaries.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 644.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
